page.title: 14FARMING - dairy
page.content: The main farming activities in a mostly rural block is{dairy farming and beef cattle. There is a wide variety of farm sizes although the area is dominated by a collection of five original farms now owned by a Life Assurance Society with a Farm manager in charge. This 'collection' totals some 1133 acres and is almost entirely devoted to dairy cattle with some animals culled for beef. The main dairy breeds here are Friesian and Holstein. Milk produced is sent to the Birmingham Dairies. The pattern remains the same on even the smallest dairy farm with the same breed of cattle being used. The average gallon production per cow is significantly higher on the bigger farm and the time taken on milking per cow is less.
